events.title: First Crusade Called by Pope Urban II
events.description: Pope Urban II called for the First Crusade at the Council of Clermont, urging Christians to reclaim the Holy Land from Muslim control.
events.significance: This marked the beginning of the Crusades, a series of religious wars that had profound effects on European and Middle Eastern history.

events.title: Great Storm of 1703 Hits England
events.description: A destructive windstorm struck southern England, causing widespread damage and thousands of deaths.
events.significance: Considered one of the worst storms in British history, it caused extensive loss of life and property, influencing future meteorological studies.

events.description: Lebanon's parliament held its first assembly, moving toward independence from French colonial rule.
events.significance: This event was a significant step in Lebanon's road toward independence, which was achieved in 1943.

events.title: Jonestown Massacre
events.description: More than 900 members of the Peoples Temple cult died in a mass murder-suicide in Jonestown, Guyana.
events.significance: This event highlighted the dangers of cults and had lasting impacts on how such groups are viewed and monitored globally.

events.title: Angela Merkel Becomes Chancellor of Germany
events.description: Angela Merkel was sworn in as the Chancellor of Germany, becoming the first woman to hold this position.
events.significance: Merkel's leadership would influence European and global politics for over a decade.
